meanings.definition: To force someone to do something against their will.
meanings.sent1: The bully was coercing the smaller kids to give him their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was coercing the witness to change their testimony.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked about coercing the rabbits to jump out of the hat on command.
meanings.sent4: The storm was coercing the trees to bend and sway in its powerful winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look was coercing the students into silence.

meanings.definition: The act of using threats or intimidation to make someone do something.
meanings.sent1: The coercing by the gang members made the shop owner fearful for his safety.
meanings.sent2: The coercing by the company's management led to a formal complaint by the employees.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's silly attempts at coercing always ended in comical failure.
meanings.sent4: The coercing of the waves against the shore created a mesmerizing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The politician's coercing of voters raised concerns about ethical campaigning.
